page.title: 12WALDRINGFIELD BAPTIST CHURCH
page.content: The Baptist Chapel was built in 1821 by a group of christians who came from Newbourne. The building is situated a mile and a half from waldringfield and is beside the Martlesham to Newbourne Road. The Church serves the villages of Waldringfield, Bucklesham,Newbourne, Brightwell and Martlesham. Regular services on a Sunday include Family Worship at 11am and 2.30pm.and a Sunday School called "Discoverers" at 10.15am. About 35 people attend regularly on a Sunday. Mid-week services include a Prayer and Bible Study on Thursdays and a Fellowship of Youth for children and teenagers on a Friday. The present Pastor lives at Kesgrave, about 4 miles away and apart from preaching at the main services he spends much of his time in preparation and visiting people in their homes or at the hospitals.
